trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of adding ketamine infusion to propofol sedation on hemodynamic changes and recovery in patients undergoing elective lower limb surgery under spinal anaesthesia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Addition of ketamine infusion to propofol sedation with spinal anesthesia in patients undergoing elective lower limb surgery: Hemodynamic changes, Recovery Profile

conditions.healthcondition: sedation for elective lower limb surgery

interventions.interventions: Intravenous infusions of propofol alone and ketamine combined with propofol during sedation. In group P: Propofol infusion dose is 25-75 mcg/kg/min and titrated according to Ramsey Sedation Score. In group KP: Propofol was managed like in Group P and ketamine dose is 1/3 of propofol in terms of mg.
interventions.comparator: In group P: Propofol infusion dose is 25-75 mcg/kg/min

primaryOutcome.outcome: To observe difference in terms of hemodymanic parameters which were heart rate with electrocardiogram, noninvasive systolic, diastolic, mean blood pressure, peripheral oxygen saturation with pulse oxymetry. (composite outcome)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: All measurements done every 5 minutes during surgery.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Recovery profile assessed with mini mentel state examination
primaryOutcome.timepoint: MMSE done first preoperatively and secondly thirty minutes after the sedation ending.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Side effects of ketamine infusion like agitation, vomiting, emergence reactions.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During sedation and in thirty minutes of the recovery period
Postoperative questionnaire administered post-operatively on a three-point scale (1 = bad, 2 = borderline 3 = good)
Postoperative questionnaire administered post-operatively on a three-point scale (1 = bad, 2 = borderline 3 = good)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 25-80 years old Both gender Candidate of elective lower limb surgery Do not have contraindications for spinal anesthesia
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients with a allergic reaction to propofol or ketamine, obesity (BMI greater than or equal to 35) Â , uncontrolled hypertension ( greater than 170/100mmHg), clinically significant cardiac, pulmonary, hepatic, renal dysfunction, psychiatric disorders, neurologic impairment were exluded from study.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Talatpasa Avenue, Ankara Numune Education and Research Hospital, Postcode: 06100, City: Ankara

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We tried to evaluate the difference between two sedation drugs with the route of ; propofol alone intravenous infusion and ketamine-propofol combined intravenous infusion. We studied during lower limb surgery with spinal anesthesia. And observed patients hemodynamic values, mini mental state examination scores, postoperative events, satisfaction scores.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Not published or presented. Only submitted to European Journal of Anesthesia a few days ago and is under editor assessment.
